item.text: Moses told the leaders of the tribes concerning the Israelites, “This is what the Lord has commanded:
If a man makes a vow to the Lord or takes an oath of binding obligation on himself, he must not break his word, but must do whatever he has promised.
“If a young woman who is still living in her father’s house makes a vow to the Lord or places herself under an obligation,

and her <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">hears</st> of her <st data-num="05088" class="">vow</st> or the <st data-num="0632" class="">obligation</st> to <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> she has <st data-num="0631 05921">pledged</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">herself</st>, and her <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="02790" class="">remains silent</st> about her,<n id="1" /> then <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="05088" class="">vows</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="0632" class="">obligation</st> to <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> she has <st data-num="0631 05921">pledged</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">herself</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>.

But if her father overrules her when he hears about it, then none of her vows or her obligations that she has pledged for herself will stand. And the Lord will release her from it, because her father overruled her.
“And if she marries a husband while under a vow, or she uttered anything impulsively by which she has pledged herself,

and her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">hears</st> about it but <st data-num="02790" class="">remains silent</st> about her <st data-num="03117" class="">when</st> he <st data-num="08085" class="">hears about</st> it, then her <st data-num="05088" class="">vows</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st> and her <st data-num="0632" class="">obligations</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> she has <st data-num="0631" class="">pledged</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">herself</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>.

But if when her husband hears it he overrules her, then he will nullify the vow she has taken, and whatever she uttered impulsively that she has pledged for herself. And the Lord will release her from it.
“But every vow of a widow or of a divorced woman which she has pledged for herself will remain intact.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> she <st data-num="05087" class="">made the vow</st> in her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="0631" class="">put</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">herself</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">under</st> <st data-num="0632" class="">obligation</st> with an <st data-num="07621" class="">oath</st>,

and her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard about</st> it, but <st data-num="02790" class="">remained silent</st> about her, and did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05106" class="">overrule</st> her, then <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="05088" class="">vows</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="0632" class="">obligation</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> she <st data-num="0631" class="">pledged</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">herself</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>.

But if her husband clearly nullifies them when he hears them, then whatever she says by way of vows or obligations will not stand. Her husband has made them void, and the Lord will release her from them.
“Any vow or sworn obligation that would bring affliction to her, her husband can confirm or nullify.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="02790" class="">remains completely</st> <st data-num="02790" class="">silent</st><n id="1" /> about her from <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, he thus <st data-num="06965" class="">confirms</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="05088" class="">vows</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="0632" class="">obligations</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> she is <st data-num="05921" class="">under</st>; he <st data-num="06965" class="">confirms</st> them <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> he <st data-num="02790" class="">remained silent</st> about her <st data-num="03117" class="">when</st> he <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> them.
But if he should nullify them after he has heard them, then he will bear her iniquity.”
These are the statutes that the Lord commanded Moses, relating to a man and his wife, and a father and his young daughter who is still living in her father’s house.
